author: parithosh
content:
To kickoff the 2022 testnet season, I've created a doc here to list branch/docker image information (entered version/branch should be compatible with kiln spec v1) : https://notes.ethereum.org/@ExXcnR0-SJGthjz1dwkA1A/ryoL1py1q/edit

The current plan is to have `merge-devnet-4` by the end of the week if there's enough interest. It'd be great if participating client teams can update the doc linked above and perhaps send me a small list of changes I might need to make to flags/deployments (if any) ðŸ˜„

Incase someone has already tried interop or local testnets with other clients, do let me know! 

To help with local testing, the team from Kurtosis has built something awesome for us. We now have the ability to spin up a multi-client, local merge testnet. This could be really valuable to test client changes against known working versions of other clients. We'd look into potential integration testing in the future. Kurtosis also supports writing tests modules, if someone has ideas, do reach out. 

Information on how to get started can be found in this note: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ExXcnR0-SJGthjz1dwkA1A/H11OzhRAK
Current version numbers, etc in the kurtosis docs are pinned to kintsugi, once we have newer versions for kiln I can update it and client teams can use kurtosis until the devnet is launched.

Potential workflow for client teams:
Build/test locally -> Test few combinations with kurtosis -> Test large scale on weekly devnet/Kiln -> Make public releases/rc's

author: diegolosada
content:
Hi all ðŸ™‚

This is Diego from Ethereum on ARM.

We've released a Kintsugi image for the Raspberry Pi 4. It is Plug and play so it does all the necessary configuration and includes all clients ready to run through systemd services. For instance, if you want to run Geth and Lighthouse as EL+CL just start both services by running:

`sudo systemctl start geth-lh && sudo systemctl start lh-geth-beacon`

Additionally, we published an AWS ARM64 AMI for users that want to give it a try but don't have a Raspberry Pi (it is the same image but for this environment).

Please take a look at our docs for further info:

https://ethereum-on-arm-documentation.readthedocs.io/en/latest/kintsugi/kintsugi-testnet.html

Feel free to join our Discord or post here your feedback.

https://discord.gg/jU9cP64mPe

Thanks!

author: ajsutton
content: We did recently discover that besu is (correctly) validating the finalized hash that it gets sent. Teku this whole time turns out to have been sending the head hash as the finalized hash.  So might be worth pulling the latest teku develop image to get that fix.
